item.title: Ethereum Surges, Briefly Breaks $4400 Mark
item.description: On August 30th, according to HTX market data, Ethereum experienced a rebound and briefly exceeded $4400. It is now trading at $4396.

item.title: Meme Coin EGL1 Surges 22.6% in 24 Hours, Current Market Cap at $52.23 Million
item.description: On August 30th, based on GMGN market data, the Meme coin EGL1 witnessed a 22.6% surge in the past 24 hours. It has a market capitalization of $52.23 million and a 24-hour trading volume of $36.81 million.

item.title: Hong Kong Police Busts "Rug Pull" Stablecoin Fraud Case, Seizes HKD 3 Million in Cash and Arrests Three
item.description: August 30th. According to Hong Kong Wen Wei Po, Inspector Tsang Kin Wah of the Technology and Wealth Crime Unit in the Hong Kong Central Police District disclosed the resolution of a "Blessing Scam" stablecoin fraud case. A 77-year-old woman took 3 million Hong Kong dollars in cash to a virtual currency exchange shop on Wellington Street in Central to purchase a stablecoin but was deceived by the staff through a "fake blessing." The Hong Kong police, using the "Sharp Eye Plan" footage, conducted a thorough investigation and intelligence analysis and arrested 3 male and female fraudsters within three days of the incident. They are currently charged with obtaining property by deception and are actively investigating other suspects and the recovery of the remaining proceeds of the crime. There is no ruling out the possibility of more arrests.

item.title: GoPlus Successfully Completes Hardware Wallet Evaluation Event, Promoting Web3 Security Education and Industry Collaboration
item.description: On August 30th, the "Wallet Wars" hardware wallet evaluation event hosted by Web3 security infrastructure GoPlus officially came to an end this week. The wallet projects participating in the hardware evaluation included Coolwallet, imKey, KeyPal, Keystone, OneKey, and SafePal. The event lasted for a total of three weeks. An expert jury evaluated the hardware wallets across six dimensions and released the "Web3 Hardware Wallet Security Evaluation Report," providing users with a more intuitive and objective purchasing reference. The event reached a total of millions of users and became an important case in promoting Web3 security education and industry transparency.As the initiator of the evaluation event, GoPlus continues to give top priority to security: its API has covered more than 40 public chains, with an average of more than 30 million daily calls, protecting a cumulative total of more than 28 million wallets and avoiding potential losses of more than 5 billion USD. item.title: Analyst: Bitcoin Price Drops Below Short-Term HODLers' Average Price, Causing Market Panic, Whales Still Accumulating During the Dip
item.description: August 30th. On-chain data analyst Murphy posted on social media, indicating that when the Bitcoin price dropped below the short-term holder's average price of $108,000, the short-term sentiment changed from being anxious to being panicked. Currently, it is the weekend with low liquidity, which makes it likely to experience larger fluctuations.For investors who are still bullish on the overall BTC trend, there has been no pause in their accumulation during the pullback. The BTC balance on the Kraken exchange decreased significantly by 41,512 BTC in the two days from August 27th to August 29th. Based on previous chain analysis, Kraken's address is closely related to some treasury companies, traditional institutions, and OTC platforms.

item.title: Upbit Exchange Trading Volume Rebounds, with XRP, ETH, and SOL Ranking Top Three
item.description: On August 30th, according to CoinGecko data, in the past 24 hours, the trading volume on Upbit has rebounded to $4.33 billion, showing a 10.6% increase. Among them, the XRP/KRW trading pair accounted for 16.87% of the trading volume and ranked first in the Korean won market. The remaining top five are: ETH, SOL, BTC, and PYTH.

item.title: Yesterday, the U.S. Ethereum Spot ETF saw a net outflow of $164.6 million
item.description: On August 30th, as monitored by Farside Investors, yesterday the net outflow of the US Ethereum spot ETF was $164.6 million. This includes:- BlackRock ETHA: $0- Fidelity FETH: -$51 million- Bitwise ETHW: -$23.7 million- Grayscale ETHE: -$28.6 million- Grayscale Ethereum Trust: -$61.3 million

item.title: Radiant Capital Hacker Spends $23.7 Million to Buy 5475 ETH
item.description: On August 30, as per the monitoring of on-chain data analyst Yu Jin, the hacker address of Radiant Capital, which has been involved in multiple swing trading activities recently, spent 23.7 million DAI and purchased 5,475 ETH at a price of $4,330 within the past hour. However, its last transaction a week ago was to sell ETH at a price of $4,726.

item.title: Yesterday the US Bitcoin spot ETF experienced a net outflow of $1.267 billion
item.description: On August 30th, according to the monitoring of Farside Investors, the net outflow of the US Bitcoin spot ETF yesterday was $126.7 million, including:BlackRock IBIT: +$24.6 millionFidelity FBTC: -$66.2 millionARK ARKB: -$72.1 millionValkyrie BTCW: +$2.3 millionGrayscale GBTC: -$15.3 million

item.title: CryptoQuant Research Manager: If Bitcoin fails to quickly recover above $112,000, the next downside support level will be around $100,000
item.description: On August 30th, Julio Moreno, the Head of Research at CryptoQuant, posted on social media, indicating that from a short-term valuation standpoint, if Bitcoin is unable to promptly regain the $11,200 level, the next support level will be approximately $10,000.
